p: The qualitative and quantitative studies on bioactive compounds isolated from plants depend greatly on proper choice of extraction method, which plays a crucial role in obtaining satisfactory results ( Table 2) [ 45]. The most important factors affecting the extraction process are related to the properties of the plant, the applied solvent, temperature, pressure and time of extraction [ 43–45]. There are classical extraction methods such as Soxhlet extraction, maceration, decoction and infusion, and modern methods, such as supercritical fluid extraction and solid-phase micro-extraction, among others [ 44, 45].
